Action.author: rberg2
Action.body: This looks like an issue with the sysadmin guide documentation. That file gets created by the command "poet genesis -k /etc/sawtooth/keys/validator.priv --enclave-module sgx -o poet_genesis.batch" If the command is run as a regular user it will fail because it can't read the private key, so running it as root is a natural thing to do. Instead the command should be run as the sawtooth user because that user can read the private key and write to /var/lib/sawtooth.

Action.author: achenette
Action.body: In this procedure, there is an earlier step that says "Become the sawtooth user and change to /tmp." However, the procedure is confusing - it's easy to miss this step. I'll make changes to reduce the confusion and make it easier to see which commands must be run as the sawtooth user.

Action.author: achenette
Action.body: I added a different prompt to the commands that must be run as the sawtooth user. See: Configure the Validator to Use SGX PoET|https://sawtooth.hyperledger.org/docs/core/nightly/master/sysadmin_guide/configure_sgx.html#configure-the-validator-to-use-sgx-poet .
